I tried several downloads and I am still missing JUST the right wing...  Any suggestions..  :(

Haha, I was just about to rip on you for stepping on Mickey then I see he flubbed. 

Anyway, this is the version from "wickedfriends" whoever they are (they were quoted where I downloaded the B58, same issues, different site and before it was even posted at TPB). I can't help but suspect this was intentionally stripped of one of it's texture flies. What is fascinating is that there are no files missing, the KLM and the Gold/Green texture folders each contain 36 files which means the individual bitmaps must have been edited.

The obvious solution is to Photoshop a mirror of the left wing and use that for the right wing texture.

there is horrible jumping effect which takes place when you change views. I have done a modification to the aircraft.cfg to fix this:   Under [Contact_Points] in the aircraft.cfg you will see static height and static pitch. replace those two lines with the following and save it.

static_pitch = 3.66
static_cg_height = 2.62

that should fix any jumping when switching views ;)

ok, I have also devised a solution for the missing textures. Open the model.cfg located within the Carendo B58 installation using notepad. Copy/paste the following text, save and exit. Re-load FSX and all textures are present.

"[models]
normal=1PB58
interior=1PB58_Interior"

I think this plane was intentionally booby trapped and the Carendo kids must be marveling at our ingenuity *smiles for the camera* :)

well see the problem is the .mdl file. All the texture files are present and intact, I confirmed this using FSRepaint, DXTBmp and Photoshop, just to make sure. It is as if they did not "paint" the wing onto this (2PB58) model and there is no known way to decompile a .mdl file to fix it. If you make other textures work that is fine but counter-intuitive because it would mean those textures had been assigned to the model instead.
 They are crappy, but I have compiled FSX models...

mickyfinny is straight up lying, the airplane .mdl with missing textures CAN NOT be repainted. All textures are already present, but the right wing is not mapped to the model file. I don't care how many times or what programs you use to paint whatever colors you please, they will NEVER show on that particular model.

 I posted the only practical solution above which is to use a different model which accepts the mapped textures.

@Aarque ive repainted this particular  model Baron58 "GoldGreen"model using FSRepaint for viewing,Dxtbmp for sending to photoshop,and for saving in Extended 32bit 888-8.And so unless i have missed something about what u said. i am not a liar.

Ok mickey my bad, but the only way you could have repainted it is with an intact model file. The one used in this installer is unable to accept textures with the format we use. FSRepaint presents tiles or plates (the .bmps or .dds' or whatever) that are mapped to the model. If the tiles already have textures which aren't blank but aren't showing in FSR or FSX, the is no way to use that model without going deeper using FSDS or MDL Tweaker or Model Converter X or something. Closest I've come to that is to be able to modify the specularity or remove LOD's or something.
